rules: Rule1: Whenever grain storage requires quality control, inventory is stocked.
Rule2: Either grain storage requires quality control or production line requires quality control.
Rule3: Under the condition that production capacity is increased, if procedures are documented then protocols are followed.
Rule4: Provided that facilities are expanded, if procedures are documented then protocols are followed.

Rule5: If processes are automated, then provided that it is not the case that either production capacity is not increased or facilities are not expanded implies resources are not constrained, growth targets are achieved.
Rule6: Given that food samples are tested, if assembly line is finished then final product is completed.
Rule7: If quality reports are reviewed, then lab results are analyzed.
Rule8: Under the condition that protocols are followed, if staff members are trained then the operation is profitable.
Rule9: Whenever production line requires quality control, the operation is profitable.
Rule10: Either licenses are renewed, or certificates are issued, or if procedures are documented then protocols are followed.
Rule11: If instruments are calibrated, then under the condition that equipment is maintained, the operation is profitable.
Rule12: If maintenance is scheduled, then instruments are calibrated.
Rule13: Either maintenance is scheduled or repairs are performed.
Rule14: If repairs are performed, then service records are updated.
Rule15: Supposing replacement parts are ordered, if service records are updated then instruments are calibrated.
Rule16: If technical support is requested, then given that service records are updated, instruments are calibrated.
Rule17: If supplies are available, then the operation is profitable.
Rule18: Either stock levels are low, or if inventory is stocked then supplies are available.
Rule19: Either raw materials are sufficient or stock levels are not low.
Rule20: If replenishment orders are placed, then raw materials are not sufficient.
Rule21: If supplier contracts are negotiated, then raw materials are not sufficient.
Rule22: Provided that supply chain is maintained, production flow is not interrupted.
Rule23: If logistics are coordinated, then supply chain is maintained.
Rule24: If resources are allocated, then personnel are assigned.
Rule25: If personnel are assigned, then shifts are scheduled.
Rule26: If shifts are scheduled, then workflow is optimized.

Rule27: Under the condition that workflow is optimized, either budget allocations are approved, or if it is not the case that grain storage requiring quality control implies profitable operation leads to raw materials not being contaminated, then safety inspection is passed.
Rule28: If quality issues are identified, then problems are not resolved.
Rule29: If corrective actions are implemented, then whenever quality issues are identified, problems are resolved.
Rule30: If processes are monitored, then if corrective actions are not implemented, defects are repeated.
Rule31: Either warnings are ignored or processes are monitored.
Rule32: If contamination is detected, then affected batches are not isolated.
Rule33: If safety inspection is passed, then cleaning process is not approved.
Rule34: Provided that recall procedure is initiated, if suspected items are quarantined then defective products are not released.
Rule35: If authorities are notified, then under the condition that suspected items are quarantined, defective products are not released.
Rule36: If incidents are investigated, then provided that operations are suspended, distribution is not continued.
Rule37: If consultants are hired, then reports are prepared.
Rule38: Either consultants are hired or internal review is conducted.
Rule39: If production facility is certified, then safety inspection is passed.
Rule40: If internal review is conducted, then whenever it is not the case that quality data being collected implies food samples are tested, lab results are analyzed.
Rule41: If documentation is submitted, then audit is completed.
Rule42: If findings are addressed, then documentation is submitted.
Rule43: If approval process is expedited, then certification is not delayed.
Rule44: If violations are reported, then under the condition that compliance data is collected, food samples are tested.
Rule45: If non-compliance is corrected, then provided that compliance data is collected, food samples are tested.
Rule46: If regulatory status is maintained, then either violations are reported or non-compliance is corrected.
Rule47: If certifications are renewed, then regulatory status is maintained.
Rule48: Either certifications are renewed or policies are updated.
Rule49: If policies are updated, then regulatory status is maintained.
Rule50: If safety protocols are implemented, then workers are trained.
Rule51: If workers are trained, then safety equipment is installed.
Rule52: If safety equipment is installed, then rules are enforced.

Rule53: If operations are supervised, then whenever rules are enforced, if it is not the case that operation not being profitable implies packaging materials are available leads to final product being completed, compliance is achieved.
Rule54: If targets are met, then deadlines are not missed.
Rule55: If technology is upgraded, then under the condition that processes are improved, efficiency is optimized.
Rule56: If operations are streamlined, then provided that processes are improved, efficiency is optimized.
Rule57: If productivity is increased, then either costs are reduced, or technology is upgraded, or operations are streamlined.
Rule58: If hygiene standards are maintained, then protocols are followed.
Rule59: If quality checks are passed, then inspections are not failed.
Rule60: If improvements are implemented, then quality checks are passed.
Rule61: Either improvements are implemented or standards are maintained.
Rule62: If standards are maintained, then quality checks are passed.
Rule63: If certification is obtained, then certificates are issued.
Rule64: If guidelines are followed, then whenever procedures are documented, protocols are followed.
Rule65: If approval is applied for, then certification is obtained.
Rule66: Either approval is applied for or compliance is demonstrated.
Rule67: If compliance is demonstrated, then evidence is provided.
Rule68: If application is submitted, then under the condition that evidence is provided, guidelines are followed.
Rule69: Either application is submitted or hearing is attended.
Rule70: Either approval is received, or if hearing is attended then provided that evidence is provided, guidelines are followed.
Rule71: If it is not the case that grain storage requiring quality control implies profitable operation, then raw materials are contaminated.
Rule72: If it is not the case that production capacity is increased or facilities are expanded, then resources are constrained.
Rule73: If it is not the case that secured funding implies if technology is invested in then processes are automated, then expansion plans are delayed.
Rule74: If it is not the case that assembly line being finished implies final product is completed, then deadlines are missed.
Rule75: If it is not the case that quality data being collected implies food samples are tested, then quality reports are reviewed.
Rule76: If it is not the case that quality data being collected implies food samples are tested, then quality issues are identified.
Rule77: If it is not the case that quality data being collected implies food samples are tested, then contamination is detected.
Rule78: If it is not the case that quality data being collected implies food samples are tested, then lab results are not analyzed.
Rule79: If it is not the case that replacement parts are ordered or technical support is requested, then equipment issues are escalated.
Rule80: If it is not the case that replacement parts are ordered or technical support is requested, then equipment issues are not escalated.
Rule81: If it is not the case that replenishment orders are placed or supplier contracts are negotiated, then production flow is interrupted.
Rule82: If it is not the case that replenishment orders are placed or supplier contracts are negotiated, then logistics are coordinated.
Rule83: If it is not the case that contamination being detected implies affected batches are isolated, then defective products are released.
Rule84: If it is not the case that contamination being detected implies affected batches are isolated, then suspected items are quarantined.
Rule85: If it is not the case that recall procedure is initiated or authorities are notified, then distribution is continued.
Rule86: If it is not the case that recall procedure is initiated or authorities are notified, then operations are suspended.
Rule87: If it is not the case that reports being prepared implies findings are addressed, then certification is delayed.
Rule88: If it is not the case that reports being prepared implies findings are addressed, then approval process is expedited.
Rule89: If it is not the case that hygiene standards being met implies production facility is certified, then shipment is delayed.
Rule90: If it is not the case that grain storage requiring quality control implies profitable operation leads to raw materials not being contaminated, then cleaning process is approved.
Rule91: If it is not the case that grain storage requiring quality control implies profitable operation leads to raw materials not being contaminated, then hygiene standards are met.
Rule92: If it is not the case that assembly line not being finished implies final product is completed leads to targets being met, then production schedule is adjusted.

Rule93: If it is not the case that assembly line not being finished implies final product is completed leads to targets being met implies production schedule is not adjusted, then processes are improved.

Rule94: If it is not the case that assembly line not being finished implies final product is completed leads to targets being met implies production schedule is not adjusted, then efficiency is not optimized.
Rule95: If it is not the case that operation not being profitable implies packaging materials are available, then assembly line is finished.
Rule96: If corrective actions are not implemented, then defects are not repeated.
Rule97: If hygiene standards are not maintained, then inspections are failed.
Rule98: If operation is not profitable, then packaging materials are not available.
facts: Fact13: Final product is not completed.
Fact14: Growth targets are not achieved.
Fact15: Expansion plans are not delayed.
Fact18: Budget allocations are not approved.
